sub_title: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD
summary:
As BU Manager West Nederland I provide operational and strategic direction for Applus+RTD. Align and drive a cross functional team to achieve and exceed revenue, market share, and operating margin targets while positioning the business for sustainable long-term growth. 

I am responsible for the management of client’s expectations to the benefit of the Company Also, develop and manage new and existing work on the client’s site by marketing inspection services, making proposals and tendering for new inspection business.

A flexible approach and stand out from the crowd is necessary in this role. 

Duties include:

•	To liaise between client and company personnel to ensure work is carried out according to an agreed schedule and within the terms of the contract.
•	Maintenance of inspection capability and resources in accordance with the Company’s policies, standards and procedures and in compliance with the requirements of applicable codes.
•	Co-ordination and execution of activities in accordance with approved procedures for the base and site operations ensuring that the quality system is adhered to on a day to day basis
•	Providing competent staff for inspection activities and ensuring that technical staff is supervised, as necessary, by staff familiar with the quality system and procedures.
•	Ensuring the availability of technical resources to support inspection.
•	To provide support to other Company geographical locations with personnel and/or equipment when required.
•	Accountable for the financial performance of the location and control to ensure it meets sales, budget and profitability targets.
•	To ensure all Company and Site Health, Safety and Environmental regulations are complied with.
•	To maintain copies of all Health, Safety, and Environmental & Quality documents procedures.
•	To manage people, resources and equipment to optimise performance.
•	Commercial flair and ability to sell in a highly technical, service orientated environment.

certifications.name: SCR AUT of Steel Caternary Riser girth welds

projects.title: Saipem Cabiunas
projects.description: The proposed Cernambi-Cabiunas project calls for the supply and installation of a giant 373-kilometre, 24-inch pipeline in water depths ranging from 100 metres to 1800 metres.

contributors.headline: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD

projects.title: Enbridge Heidelberg
projects.description:
Enbridge plans to construct, own and operate a crude oil pipeline in the Gulf of Mexico to connect the proposed Heidelberg development, operated by Anadarko Petroleum Corporation (Anadarko), to an existing third-party system.

Heidelberg, a 20-inch 58-kilometre (36-mile) pipeline, will originate in Green Canyon Block 860, approximately 320 kilometres (200 miles) southwest of New Orleans, Louisiana, and in an estimated 1,600metres (5,300 feet) of water.

Heidelberg is expected to be operational by 2016 at an approximate cost of US$0.1 billion.

contributors.headline: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD

projects.title: Maersk Roar Gas lift
projects.description:
Tyra Southeast Oil and Gas Field is located in block 5504/12, about 200km offshore of the west coast of Denmark in the North Sea, at a water depth of 38m.
The operation of the oil and gas field comes under the jurisdiction of the Danish Underground Consortium (DUC), with Maersk Oil as the operator, holding a 31.2% interest. Other partners are Shell, holding a 36.8% share, Nordsofonden holding a 20% share and Chevron holding a 12% share.
A major expansion project is currently under way at the oil field to enable it to produce a further 50 million barrels of oil equivalent. The field, upon completion of the expansion, is expected to produce oil and gas for 30 years. Production is expected to commence in 2015.

contributors.headline: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD

projects.title: Statoil Edvard Grieg
projects.description:
The oil will be transported via a 43-kilometre oil pipeline from Edvard Grieg to the Grane oil pipeline, and then on to Sture.

The transport solution is a precondition for developing the Edvard Grieg (operated by Lundin) and Ivar Aasen (operated by Det norske oljeselskap) fields. Edvard Grieg is scheduled to start producing in 2015 and Ivar Aasen in 2016. The new pipeline will be called the Edvard Grieg oil pipeline.

contributors.headline: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD

projects.title: Maersk Tyra valdemar
projects.description: Tyra Field is the largest gas condensate field in the Danish Sector of the North Sea. It was discovered in 1968 and production started in 1984. The field is owned by Dansk Undergrunds Consortium, a partnership between Maersk Oil, Royal Dutch Shell and Chevron Corporation, and operated by Maersk Oil.

contributors.headline: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD

projects.title: BP,Skarv
projects.description:
Located on the Norwegian Continental 
Shelf, the Skarv Field is currently the 
largest ongoing field development 
offshore Norway.  The field will be 
developed using a large production 
vessel and an 80km gas export pipeline 
connected to the Åsgard Transport 
System.  The fields will be developed 
using 15 to 16 subsea wells and are 
expected to go into production in August 
2011.

contributors.headline: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD

projects.title: ConocoPhillips,Ecofisk
projects.description:
Ekofisk was Norway's first producing field and is also one of the largest on the Norwegian continental shelf. Production started in 1971.  With the projects now under development, the lifetime of the field is prepared for production towards 2050.
The Ekofisk Complex comprises all installations which are connected with bridges on the central Ekofisk field. As of 2011, this includes seven platforms plus bridge supports. In 2013/2014, a new accommodation and field center platform, Ekofisk 2/4 L, is planned to start operation at the Ekofisk Complex. In addition, a new wellhead platform, Ekofisk 2/4 Z, and a new seabed unit for water injection (Ekofisk 2/4 VB) are planned.

contributors.headline: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD

projects.title: Nordstream,Golden weld
projects.description:
Golden Weld
On 28 August, 2012, the “golden weld” connected the offshore part of the second pipeline with the onshore infrastructure in Russia at Portovaya Bay, near Vyborg. The welds connecting the offshore part of the pipeline to the onshore infrastructure in Russia and Germany are also called “golden welds” due to the complexity of their technical implementation and outstanding quality requirements.

contributors.headline: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD

projects.title: Shell,Orman lange
projects.description: The Mid North Project will be developed with a new subsea template located approximately 6 km north of the existing subsea facilities on Ormen Lange in around 900 m water depth, and will be tied back to Ormen Lange by two 12 inch diameter production pipelines, a 6 inch diameter service pipeline and a control umbilical.

contributors.headline: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD

projects.title: Statoil,Skuld
projects.description:
Fabrication and installation of rigid 
pipelines including a Direct Electrical  
Heating system and installation of flexible 
flowlines, jumpers, flying leads, risers, 
structures and umbilical. The scope also 
includes tie-in and pre-commissioning of 
the system.

contributors.headline: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD

projects.title: Total,Laggan Tormore
projects.description:
Utilising its experience, engineering 
expertise and capability in delivering 
complex projects in deepwater and 
challenging environments, Subsea 7 is 
the lead subsea contractor supporting 
the safe and efficient delivery of one of 
the North Sea’s key developments in the 
coming years - Laggan Tormore.  
The overall subsea development consists of a long distance 
tie-back of subsea wells connected to a new gas processing 
terminal at Sullom Voe on Shetland.  This comprises two 18” 
production, 8” and 2” service pipelines and control umbilicals. 
From this gas terminal, the processed gas will be exported 
through a new 30” pipeline to the UK Frigg (FUKA) pipeline 
system in the North Sea

contributors.headline: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD

projects.title: Tullow,Jubilee 1A
projects.description: Technip was awarded by Tullow Ghana Limited two contracts, worth approximately €100 million, for the Phase 1A of the Jubilee project. The Jubilee field is located offshore Ghana at a water depth of 1,300 meters.

contributors.headline: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD

projects.title: EON,Huntington
projects.description: The Subsea 7 workscope comprises the installation of 12km of the 8-inch Gas Export pipeline, installation of infield flexible flowlines, main static umbilical and associated risers as well as installation of subsea structures followed by tie-ins, pre-commissioning and system testing. Engineering work has commenced in the Aberdeen office with installation using several of Subsea 7’s fleet occurring through to 2012.

contributors.headline: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD

projects.title: Nexen,Telford
projects.description:
CTC Marine has successfully completed pre-cut trenching work on Nexen's Telford Field in the North Sea for client Subsea 7. Pre-cut trenching for a 10.4km Replacement Water Injection Pipeline was conducted utilising CTC’s 'VMP’ heavy pipeline plough onboard the high bollard trenching support vessel ‘Maersk Assister’. The spread has now returned from field and has demobilised at Teesside.

CTC will remobilise the VMP and Maersk Assister later next month for further ploughing campaigns in the North Sea.

contributors.headline: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD

projects.title: Gasunie,North-South line
projects.description:
North to south gas transport pipeline construction,
the Netherlands

contributors.headline: BU Manager West Nederland bij Applus+RTD

projects.title: Kinder Morgan,MEP
projects.description: Midcontinent Express Pipeline LLC ("MEP") is a natural gas pipeline company engaged in the business of transporting natural gas in interstate commerce. MEP's system consists of a single pipeline originating near the town of Bennington in Bryan County, Oklahoma ("Bennington") and terminating with an interconnection with Transcontinental Gas Pipe Line (“Transco”) at Transco’s Station 85 near the town of Butler in Choctaw County, Alabama ("T 85"). The pipeline is comprised of approximately thirty (30) miles of thirty inch (30") pipe, two hundred and seventy five (275) miles of forty two inch (42") pipe and one hundred and ninety seven (197) miles of thirty six inch (36") pipe.

profile_positions.description:
As BU Manager West Nederland I provide operational and strategic direction for Applus+RTD. Align and drive a cross functional team to achieve and exceed revenue, market share, and operating margin targets while positioning the business for sustainable long-term growth. 

I am responsible for the management of client’s expectations to the benefit of the Company Also, develop and manage new and existing work on the client’s site by marketing inspection services, making proposals and tendering for new inspection business.
profile_positions.title: BU Manager West Nederland

profile_positions.description:
As Site Manager, I have a vital role in all aspects of performance in the delivery of the Company’s commercial and business objectives, reporting directly to the regional manager (West).

I am responsible for the management of client’s expectations to the benefit of the Company by ensuring agreed inspection activities on the site.

Also, develop and manage new and existing work on the client’s site by marketing inspection services, making proposals and tendering for new inspection business.

A flexible approach and stand out from the crowd is necessary in this role. 

Duties include:

•	To liaise between client and company personnel to ensure work is carried out according to an agreed schedule and within the terms of the contract.
•	Maintenance of inspection capability and resources in accordance with the Company’s policies, standards and procedures and in compliance with the requirements of applicable codes.
•	Co-ordination and execution of activities in accordance with approved procedures for the base and site operations ensuring that the quality system is adhered to on a day to day basis
•	Providing competent staff for inspection activities and ensuring that technical staff is supervised, as necessary, by staff familiar with the quality system and procedures.
•	Ensuring the availability of technical resources to support inspection.
•	To provide support to other Company geographical locations with personnel and/or equipment when required.
•	Accountable for the financial performance of the location and control to ensure it meets sales, budget and profitability targets.
•	To ensure all Company and Site Health, Safety and Environmental regulations are complied with.
•	To maintain copies of all Health, Safety, and Environmental & Quality documents procedures.
•	To manage people, resources and equipment to optimise performance.
•	Commercial flair and ability to sell in a highly technical, service orientated environment.
